com.nokia.maps.component.touch

Class TouchComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.component.AbstractMapComponent
      • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.TouchComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CenteringComponent, LongTouchComponent, PinchZoomComponent, VisibleTouchComponent

    public abstract class TouchComponent
extends AbstractMapComponent
    This class offers an abstract base class for MapComponents which wish to handle touch events and gesture actions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.nokia.maps.component.AbstractMapComponent

        map

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TouchComponent(java.lang.String id)
      This method instantiates the basis of an abstract MapComponent which respond to standard Canvas touch events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TouchComponent

        public TouchComponent(java.lang.String id)
        This method instantiates the basis of an abstract MapComponent which respond to standard Canvas touch events. Subclasses should call this method when they are created. Gesture events are also handled if the MapComponent is placed on a GestureMapCanvas
        Parameters:
        id - unique Id for the component.

    • Method Detail

      • getEventListener

        public EventListener getEventListener()
        This method retrieves an EventListener instance associated with this MapComponent to handle touch events
        Specified by:
        getEventListener in interface MapComponent
        Overrides:
        getEventListener in class AbstractMapComponent
        Returns:
        an event listener for handling Touch events.

      • getExtendedEventListener

        public final ExtendedEventListener getExtendedEventListener()
        This method retrieves an ExtendedEventListener instance associated with this MapComponent to handle any events received from the Gesture API.
        Returns:
        An interface which is capable of handling gesture events.

      • isTouched

        protected abstract boolean isTouched(int x,
                int y)
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the UI has been pressed within the hit target area.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if the hit area of the component has been pressed, or false otherwise.

      • isActive

        protected abstract boolean isActive(int x,
               int y)
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the UI is active, that is a check to see if the UI has not been canceled.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if the MapComponent is currently active, or false otherwise.

      • touchAt

        protected abstract void touchAt(Point point)
        Hook to allow subclasses to respond to the touch event
        Parameters:
        point - the position touched on screen

      • getTouchPoint

        protected Point getTouchPoint(int x,
                  int y)
        Obtains the pixel coordinate of the TouchComponent which has been touched.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        The pixel coordinate of the TouchComponent which has been touched, by default this is the same as the pixel coordinate of the screen which has been touched, but the axes may be overridden

      • onTouchEventEnd

        protected boolean onTouchEventEnd(int x,
                      int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a pointer pressed event occurs.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if pointer event was consumed

      • onTouchEventStart

        protected boolean onTouchEventStart(int x,
                        int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a pointer press has started.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        false since the touch event is not consumed by default.

      • onTouchEventClear

        protected boolean onTouchEventClear(int x,
                        int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when the touch event has been cleared - usually by pressing out of the hit area.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        false since the touch event is not consumed by default.

      • onDragEvent

        protected boolean onDragEvent(int x,
                  int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a drag event occurs.
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true since the component consumes the event. By default drag events are consumed if they occur within the hit area of the MapComponent

      • onFireEvent

        protected boolean onFireEvent()
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when the FIRE key is pressed
        Returns:
        false since pressing the fire key is not consumed by default.

      • onFlickEvent

        protected boolean onFlickEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   float direction,
                   int speed,
                   int speedX,
                   int speedY)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event from the GestureMapCanvas when a flick has occurred.

        Note the TouchComponent must be placed on a GestureMapCanvas and the device must support the Gesture API to respond to the onFlickEvent() event.

        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the flick event occurred.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the flick event occurred.
        direction - direction of the flick event.
        speed - speed of the flick.
        speedX - speed of the flick on the x axis.
        speedY - speed of the flick on the y axis.
        Returns:
        false since flick events are not consumed by default.

      • onPinchEvent

        protected boolean onPinchEvent(int x,
                   int y,
                   int centerX,
                   int centerY,
                   int centerChangeX,
                   int centerChangeY,
                   int distanceStarting,
                   int distanceCurrent,
                   int distanceChange)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event from the GestureMapCanvas when a Pinch has occurred.

        Note the TouchComponent must be placed on a GestureMapCanvas and the device must support the Gesture API to respond to the onPinchEvent() event.

        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the pinch started.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen where the pinch started.
        centerX - x axis pixel coordinate describing the current centre of the pinch
        centerY - y axis pixel coordinate describing the current centre of the pinch.
        centerChangeX - difference in x axis pixel coordinate from initial to current location
        centerChangeY - difference in y axis pixel coordinate from intiial to current location
        distanceStarting - initial number of pixels between the pinch points
        distanceCurrent - current number of pixels between the pinch points
        distanceChange - difference in size between the original can current pinch sizes.
        Returns:
        false since pinch events are not consumed by default.

      • onLongPressEvent

        protected boolean onLongPressEvent(int x,
                       int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event from the GestureMapCanvas when a Long Press has occurred.

        Note the TouchComponent must be placed on a GestureMapCanvas and the device must support the Gesture API to respond to the onLongPressEvent() event.

        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been long pressed.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been long pressed.
        Returns:
        false since long press events are not consumed by default.
